downloadDescription: HPC Pack 2019 Update 1 provides enterprise-class tools, performance and scalability for a highly productive HPC environment either on premises, Hybrid or Azure Cloud.
detailsSection:
HPC Pack 2019 is a high performance computing (HPC) solution that combines a comprehensive set of deployment, administration, job scheduling, and monitoring tools for your HPC cluster environment, and a flexible platform for developing and running HPC applications. It delivers enterprise-class tools, performance and scalability for a highly productive HPC environment, providing an integrated cluster environment featuring the HPC Job Scheduler, Message Passing Interface (MPI) and Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA) interactive application support, cluster management & monitoring tools. HPC Pack 2019 also delivers cloud ready solutions for Hybrid and Cloud on Microsoft Azure.

HPC Pack 2019 Update 1 is the first update for HPC Pack 2019. Please check the 'What's New' and 'Release Notes' available on the Microsoft HPC Pack Documentations.
systemRequirementsSection:
HPC Pack 2019 Update 1 supported Operating Systems
  • Head nodes: Windows Server 2019, Windows Server 2016, Windows Server 2012 R2 (no support for SQL Express 2019)
  • Compute nodes: Windows Server 2022, Windows Server 2019, Windows Server 2016, Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2012
  • Broker nodes: Windows Server 2022, Windows Server 2019, Windows Server 2016, Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2012
  • Workstation nodes: x86 or x64 versions of Windows 8.1 Pro or Enterprise, windows 10, windows 11
  • Unmanaged server nodes: Windows Server 2022, Windows Server 2019, Windows Server 2016, Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2012
  • Linux Compute nodes: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.7 - 8.5, CentOS-based 7.6 - 7.9, Ubuntu Server 16.04 LTS, Ubuntu Server 18.04 LTS, Alma Linux 8.5, Rocky Linux 8.5, SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12 - 15
  • Client: Windows Server 2022, Windows Server 2019, Windows Server 2016, Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2012, Windows 11, Windows 10, Windows 8.1


    • Additional notes: CPU: x64 architecture computer, except for Workstation nodes which may run x86-based or x64-based processors
    RAM: 4GB
    Minimum disk space for setup: 50 GB
    Network interface card: At least one network interface card (NIC) is required. Additional NICs may be required depending on the selected network topology
installInstructionSection:
Prior to installation, please review the 'What's New' and 'Release Notes' available on the Microsoft HPC Pack Documentations.

o Slipstream installation:

Download the 'HPCPack2019Update1-Full-v7531.zip' file, extract the contents to the root of your drive and run 'setup.exe' to start the HPC Pack 2019 Update 1 installation wizard on a supported Windows Server based computer. For Linux compute nodes, please check 'How to add Linux nodes'.

o Upgrade installation:

Download the ‘HPCPack2019Update1-Patch-v7531.zip’ file, follow the steps in the doc 'Update to HPC Pack 2019 Update 1' to upgrade the existing HPC Pack 2019 cluster to Update 1.

o Redistributable client utilities:

To install stand-alone and redistributable installer for the Microsoft HPC Pack 2019 Update 1 Client Utilities, download and run either the HpcClient_x64.msi or HpcClient_x86.msi as appropriate to your hardware platform.
